newsitem.title: FINLAND: Konecranes warns analysts on Jan-April.
newsitem.headline: Konecranes warns analysts on Jan-April.

text.p: Finnish industrial cranes maker KCI Konecranes International Oy said on Wednesday analysts predicting a clear increase in January-April profits had not understood the steep seasonality of its revenue and profit accumulation.

"The analysts, predicting a profit considerably over 1996 first tertial have not fully understood the steep seasonality of KCI Konecranes' revenue and profit accumulation," it said in a statement, referring to a Reuters poll.
But it said the analysts' full-year 1997 forecasts were in line with company expectations.

A Reuters survey of 10 analysts published on Tuesday showed a 46.5 million markka median forecast for Konecranes' January-April profit after financial items. The mean was 49.5 million markka, and the forecasts were in a 33-67 million markka range.
In January-April 1996, Konecranes posted a 36.2 million markka profit.
Eight analysts also gave forecasts for Konecranes' full-year 1997 profit.
The median was 250 million markka and the mean 246 million, in a 230-257 million markka range. Konecranes' 1996 profit before extraordinary items and tax was 208.2 million markka.
